content.description:
IMAGE 1: CENTER PIVOT IRRIGATION, CIMARRON, KANSAS, UNITED STATES

IMAGE 2: IRRIGATED TERRACES, YUANYANG, YUNNAN, CHINA

Source: Esri Data Partners

Cultural practices such as land use may vary across geographical locations because of physical geography and available resources. The images illustrate two different ways humans have modified the natural landscape.
content.question:
A. Describe the topography shown in Image 2.

B. Explain how the land use practice shown in Image 1 resulted in land cover change.

C. Explain a positive effect that terracing may have on a rural society.

D. Explain the degree to which mechanized irrigation has increased the carrying capacity of land used for agriculture.

E. Explain how government policies may allow farmers in developed countries to compete with imported crops from developing countries.

frqParts.text:

unit.text: 5: Agriculture and Rural Land-Use Patterns and Processes

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Describe the spatial patterns presented in visual sources.
